body_content.explanation: someone who controls and looks after animals, especially horses or cows on a ranch (= a large farm in North or South America):
examples: I'm working as a horse wrangler - I've been riding all my life.
The kids can watch actual wranglers at work at a ranch just south of the campground.
He worked as a tourist guide and crocodile wrangler.

body_content.explanation: a person who deals with or controls something or someone, often when this is difficult:
examples: She's now his co-producer and general wrangler on the film set.
His key skill is as an information wrangler.

body_content.explanation: at the University of Cambridge, a student of mathematics who has passed their final examinations with first class honours (= the highest possible level):
examples: He had a distinguished undergraduate career, being a Wrangler in Part II of the Mathematical Tripos.
The student attaining the highest marks was called the senior wrangler.
